title: Plaque, "Willows along a Silent Stream", 1913
markings:
Impressed on back, RP cipher with 14 flames, XIII beneath, also, V / three lozenge shaped marks which are unknown.

Graphite notations on back, including '35' in upper right.
signed: Signed on front, lower right, underglaze: E. Diers.
provenance:
Jordan-Volpe Gallery, New York
Marcia and William Goodman

Marcia and William Goodman
dimensions:
H x W x D: 21.6 x 27.3 x 2.25 cm ( 8 1/2 x  10 3/4 x  7/8 in)
With Frame H x W: 35.4 x 41.3 cm (14 1/8 x 16 1/4 in.)

Depth 2.25 cm (7/8 in.)
creditline: Gift of Marcia and William Goodman
description:
Rectangular plaque set into a plain oak frame.
Cast, white stoneware plaque decorated with misty tropical scene with a tree covered with hanging moss in foreground and palm trees along the banks of a still river; more palm trees and foliage in background. Predominately in shades of greens, blues and blue-grays. Vellum glaze on front and partially on sides; cracklature. Back not glazed.

tombstone.epitaph:
Plaque, "Willows along a Silent Stream", 1913.
1913. Glazed stoneware,  Wood frame.. Gift of Marcia and William Goodman. 1984-84-21.
